body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

I have a Powershell script with embedded C# code. 

Being used to use the more compact "`function {`" programming convention for curly braces, I modified it by **only** moving `{` from below to next after the function name, like this:
```Powershell
Set-StrictMode -Version Latest
$ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
$CSharpCode = @'
...

public static SafeFileHandle GetConIn() {
    SafeFileHandle fileHandle = CreateFileW("CONIN$", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, IntPtr.Zero, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, IntPtr.Zero);
    if (fileHandle.IsInvalid)
    {
        throw new System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception();
    }
    return fileHandle;
}
...
}
'@

$NativeMethods = Add-Type -Language CSharp -MemberDefinition $CSharpCode -Name NativeMethods -Namespace Console -PassThru -UsingNamespace 'Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
if (-not $NativeMethods) { throw "Fatal error: Unable to compile the necessary C# code." }

```

The script then fails with: 
```powershell
 $ .\get_console_mode_gist.ps1
Add-Type: C:\Users\xxxx\PowerShell\get_console_mode_gist.ps1:39
Line |
  39 |  … veMethods = Add-Type -Language CSharp -MemberDefinition $CSharpCode - …
     |                ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | Cannot add type. Compilation errors occurred.
```


### Expected behavior

```console
To not make a difference on where I put my `{}`'s.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Fails due to placement of the `{}`s.
```


### Error details

_No response_
